common.footerLine: Evidence-based endurance coaching with a calm, athlete-first process.

home.heroTitle: Evidence-based endurance coaching built on physiology, not trends.
home.heroSubtitle: Bridging sport science and real-world training for ambitious age-group athletes.
home.heroCred: Focus on physiology understanding â€¢ Currently accepting a limited number of athletes
optimizeItems: Physiology-led training decisions you can understand and apply
Aerobic durability and threshold development for sustainable performance
Practical race execution and fueling aligned with real life
home.aboutBody: I'm Milan, a UESCA Certified Triathlon Coach focused on running, cycling and triathlon. My work bridges physiology and practical training: I combine pace, power, HR, lactate and RPE with real-life context so decisions are clear, realistic, and useful.
aboutBullets: Approach: individualization, progressive overload, recovery respect

principles.title: Intensity has a cost
principles.body: Hard sessions are used carefully, not constantly.

principles.title: Data needs context
principles.body: Numbers help, but athlete feedback decides.

principles.title: Education matters
principles.body: You learn your body and your process.

home.offerBody: Personal training plan and ongoing feedback for committed athletes, built around your schedule, goals, and response to training.
offerItems: Individual weekly training plan (run/cycle; tri integrated)
Session feedback and adjustments based on performance + RPE
Review of key workouts and trend tracking
Monthly progress review and next-step planning
Fueling guidance for training and race day
auditItems: Identify the primary limiter and priority fixes
fitYes: Athletes who value structure and feedback
People who want to understand training decisions
Busy adults integrating training with life
fitNo: Looking for quick hacks or constant high intensity
Not ready to communicate and recover consistently
Want only generic plans with no feedback loop
home.developingTitle: Why work with a developing coach?
home.developingBody: Because the process is current and athlete-focused: up-to-date with research, a small roster for high attention, detail-oriented planning, and no outdated dogma. I focus on bridging physiology and practical training, and I am currently building a small roster of committed athletes.

processSteps.title: Intro call (15-20 min)
processSteps.body: We align on goals, training history, constraints, and expectations.

processSteps.title: Setup week
processSteps.body: We set zones/testing if needed, your schedule, and first week structure.

processSteps.title: Train and iterate
processSteps.body: Weekly updates, feedback loop, and progressive build.

home.resourcesBody: Practical sports science notes you can apply immediately.
home.bottomCtaBody: If you want structure and feedback, let's talk.

resources.intro: Practical sports science for endurance athletes.

points: How to keep easy days truly easy

contact.title: Contact
contact.intro: Book an intro call or send a message. If a call is not feasible due to time zones, email works perfectly.
contact.callText: Best for a quick first conversation and clear next steps.
contact.emailText: Use the direct email option or the pre-filled form below.
contact.formText: This opens your default email client with all details pre-filled.
contact.timezoneNote: If a call isn't feasible due to time zones, email is perfect.
